purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 涛)
Pictophonetic: 壽 indicates the sound; 氵 (water) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 氵 [ shuǐ ] water
    • 壽 [ shòu ] old age, longevity; lifespan
heisig_chinese_memo: Large waves almost look like the long gray beard of water, and of course have great longevity.
Ru_trainchinese: tāo: (графема) большие волны; шум морских волн
Kanshudo_mnemonic: longevity (壽) in the water (氵) is a wave
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Long gray beard man likes to get on the water and catch some large waves when he's taking a break from the farmland.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " water " to " shou " sound. The original meaning is big waves and waves. "Shuowen Xinfu": "Tao, big waves. From water, longevity." Such as "Lun Heng. "Book Xu": "Qu Yuan cherishes hatred, he voted for the Xiangjiang River, and Xiangjiang is not the Tao." Wei Cao Zhi of the Three Kingdoms "Gift to the White Horse Wang Biao": "Rafting over the floods, complaining about the long east road."

" Tao " also expresses the same sound as waves. For example, Ouyang Xuan of the Yuan Dynasty: "Come and sip tea in Han Changshu, sit down and listen to the pine waves." Ming Dynasty Wang Shizhen, "Youyu Mountain Fushui Rock": "The wind and rock paintings stirred the sky and rain, and the gloomy cold Give birth to Wan Shutao."

Oracle has a glyph from "水" to " 𠃬 ", or it is interpreted as "涛". (Shang Chengzuo) "Collection" 10984: "...Tian Yu 𣵬." " 𣵬 " is used as a place name.
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " water " and " shou ". The original meaning is big waves and waves.
humanum_full_description:
從「水」，「壽」聲。本義是大浪、波濤。《說文新附》：「濤，大波也。从水，壽聲。」如《論衡．書虛》：「屈原懷恨，自投湘江，湘江不為濤。」三國魏曹植〈贈白馬王彪〉：「汎舟越洪濤，怨彼東路長。」

　　「濤」又表示波濤一樣的聲音。如元代歐陽玄〈漫題四絕〉：「翰長書閑來啜茗，下簾危坐聽松濤。」明代王世貞〈游虞山拂水巖〉：「風巖畫激諸天雨，陰壑寒生萬樹濤。」

　　甲骨文有從「水」從「𠃬」的字形，或釋為「濤」。（商承祚）《合集》10984：「…田于𣵬。」「𣵬」用為地名。
humanum_short_description: 從「水」，「壽」聲。本義是大浪、波濤。

Chinese: Large waves almost look like the long gray beard of water, and of course have great longevity.  
Meaning: large waves
Hanzi: 涛
Story: Long gray beard man likes to get on the water and catch some large waves when he's taking a break from the farmland.
Kind: traditional

從「 水 」，「 壽 」聲。本義是大浪、波濤。《說文新附》：「濤，大波也。从水，壽聲。」如《論衡．書虛》：「屈原懷恨，自投湘江，湘江不為濤。」三國魏曹植〈贈白馬王彪〉：「汎舟越洪濤，怨彼東路長。」 「 濤 」又表示波濤一樣的聲音。如元代歐陽玄〈漫題四絕〉：「翰長書閑來啜茗，下簾危坐聽松濤。」明代王世貞〈游虞山拂水巖〉：「風巖畫激諸天雨，陰壑寒生萬樹濤。」 甲骨文有從「 水 」從「 𠃬 」的字形，或釋為「 濤 」。（商承祚）《合集》10984：「…田于𣵬。」「 𣵬 」用為地名。

"Book Xu": "Qu Yuan cherishes hatred, he voted for the Xiangjiang River, and Xiangjiang is not the Tao." Wei Cao Zhi of the Three Kingdoms "Gift to the White Horse Wang Biao": "Rafting over the floods, complaining about the long east road." " Tao" also expresses the same sound as waves. For example, Ouyang Xuan of the Yuan Dynasty: "Come and sip tea in Han Changshu, sit down and listen to the pine waves." Ming Dynasty Wang Shizhen, "Youyu Mountain Fushui Rock": "The wind and rock paintings stirred the sky and rain, and the gloomy cold Give birth to Wan Shutao." Oracle has a glyph from " 水" to " 𠃬", or it is interpreted as " 涛". (Shang Chengzuo) "Collection" 10984: "...Tian Yu 𣵬." " 𣵬" is used as a place name.

濤字的基本解释

濤
tāo
见“涛”。

濤字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tāo］
［《廣韻》徒刀切，平豪，定。］
亦作“涭2”。“涛1”的繁体字。
(1)大波浪。
(2)波涛一样的声音。
(3)用同“淘”。淘洗。
[②]［cháo］
［《集韻》陳留切，平尤，澄。］
通“潮1”。“涛2”的繁体字。
潮汐。
[③]［dào］
［《集韻》大到切，去号，定。］
通“燾1”。“涛3”的繁体字。
覆盖。

濤字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　濤； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页656第12
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?徒刀切，音陶。【說文】大波也。【郭璞·江賦】激逸勢以前驅，乃鼓怒而作濤。　又【集韻】陳留切，音儔。義同。　又是酉切，音受。與?同。水名，在蜀。或作濤。　又大到切，音導。與燾同。【說文】溥覆照也。　又【韻補】叶陳如切，音除。【柳宗元詩】蒸蒸在家，其父世漁。飮酒不節，死於風濤。

濤字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

暂无。
